intro: Exacum trinervium subsp. pallidum, commonly known as the pale-stemmed African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its pale green stems and broad, velvety leaves. It produces clusters of pale pink to white flowers that bloom throughout the year under proper care. This plant is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
